heading: net stocks slide in heavy trading
subheading: the nasdaq plunges on a tech-sector selloff and news of brisk consumer spending in november. aol and amazon.com lead the parade of losers.
author: reuters
text: stocks fell tuesday, hobbled by a drop in the technology sector and a jump in long-term interest rates on news that shoppers went on a big spending spree last month. the dow jones industrial average ended down 32.42 points, or 0.29 percent, at 11,160.17.the nasdaq composite index plunged 86.46 points, or 2.37 percent, to 3,571.71 after racking up 23 record closes in 31 trading sessions."the nasdaq is at long last starting to go down," said hugh johnson, chief investment officer at first albany."you could attribute it to profit-taking ... set in motion by very sharp declines in the bond market as there is a growing concern that the economy remains too strong," he said.internet stocks, which helped spur the nasdaq to a series of record highs over the past four weeks, fell sharply.the us treasury's 30-year bond plunged 1 8/32 and the yield jumped to 6.30 percent -- its highest level since 2 december -- from 6.20 percent monday, on worries that the federal reserve may have to raise interest rates again to slow the economy's growth.in another sign of a speeding economy, the government reported us retail stores perked up in november, beating forecasts, as shoppers hit stores after the thanksgiving day holiday in the traditional run-up to christmas.the commerce department said total sales soared 0.9 percent to a seasonally adjusted us$255.8 billion -- nearly twice the 0.5 percent increase forecast by wall street economists -- after a gain of 0.3 percent in october.the jump in bond interest rates rattled financial stocks.among the dow components, american express (axp) slumped 5 13/16 to 160 1/2 and j.p. morgan (jpm) was off 3 5/16 at 131 1/4. citigroup (c) was off 1-13/16 at 53-1/2.meanwhile, the labor department reported that inflation was still subdued, with the november consumer price index up only 0.1 percent. excluding food and energy, the index rose 0.2 percent.among internet stocks, america online (aol) was off 5 13/16 at 88 1/8 and amazon.com (amzn) slid 6 7/8 to 95 5/8.semiconductor stocks fell after solectron (slr), a custom electronics maker, slumped 10 7/16 to 82 5/8 on disappointing quarterly results.analysts said a shortage of components had hurt solectron, and fear about the shortage dragged down chip makers. among them, intel (intc), a dow component, was off 1 10/16 at 72 7/16 and texas instruments (txn) was off 9 3/8 at 96 9/16.cisco systems (csco) was off 3 1/4 at 97 15/16 and oracle (orcl)fell 2 7/8 to 76 15/16.microsoft (msft) rose 2 1/16 to 98 11/16 on speculation that there was a settlement of the government's antitrust suit against the company. microsoft said the rumors were "unfounded."in the broader market, declining stocks outnumbered advances 2,035 to 1,070 on active volume of 1 billion shares on the new york stock exchange.the standard & poor's 500 index was off 12.05 points, or 0.85 percent, at 1,403.17.
